descriptionNullable:
This dataset is built from 2 separate datasets: liar liar pants on fire and ISOT. 
Proper citations are provided below:
W. Y. Wang, “” liar, liar pants on fire”: A new benchmark dataset for fake news detection,” arXiv preprint arXiv:1705.00648, 2017.
H. Ahmed, I. Traore, and S. Saad, “Detecting opinion spams and fake news using text classification,” Journal of Security and Privacy, vol. 1, no. 1, 2018.
“Detection of online fake news using n-gram analysis and machine learning techniques,” in Intelligent, Secure, and Dependable Systems in Distributed and Cloud Environments: First International Conference, ISDDC 2017, Vancouver, BC, Can- ada, October 26-28, 2017, Proceedings 1. Springer, 2017, pp. 127–138.

The data from these 2 sources has been pre-processed, meaning some fields were left out and also some inputs, as it only covers a binary classification.
title: Fake news in politics
